channel.title: Need help opening my files!
channel.description: Hi, I recently downloaded a source and I need to change alot of the settings just to add ''hidden bonuses'' and mess up all the attack and defence of items :) (i like messing around with files) But, I cannot open the .class files or the 'microsoft outlook configuration file' files. I looked up on the web which to download, and I get sent to 500 different tools. Please can you give me some links to exactly what I need to download? (the microsoft outlook config files are the ones which have 4 different square things as a logo) Thank you so much

item.title: Need help opening my files!
item.dc:creator: @Continue Continue
item.description:
@Continue wrote:

[quote=“skellz, post:3, topic:326058”]Ok thanks alot. I’m an idiot, and Ive been coding well, for like, 5 minutes
What exactly is a compied file, is it like a compressed one or something?
Thanks

And how do I open .dat files? Thanks again[/quote]

A compile file is when you basically make your .class files for what the .java files are. But, the .class files aren’t supposed to be edited. The .java files are. A .class file is there for a reason, to run your program. When you run your program, the .class files are used. If you changed anything, but did not compile, then updates will not be read and so, you need to compile the .java files so that the .class files will know be updated and let you have the updates you wanted. You do not open a .dat file with any text editor. Open it up with a model viewer such as dat maker. The ONLY thing you really should edit, are the .java files. Those may be opened with a text editor.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help opening my files!
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

[quote=“sjoukjeowns, post:7, topic:326058”][quote author=Telenim link=topic=422474.msg3101298#msg3101298 date=1263729916]

[quote author=skellz link=topic=422474.msg3101285#msg3101285 date=1263727884]
And how do I open .dat files? Thanks again
[/quote]There is nothing in .DAT files that you need to know about. You can’t open it with a text editor. (eh, you can but you can’t edit anything)
[/quote]~
Not true i open dat model files…[/quote]That’s because you’re using a model viewer, I just said you can’t edit anything with a text editor.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help opening my files!
item.dc:creator: @Telenim Telenim
item.description:
@Telenim wrote:

You don’t need to open the .class files. They are the compiled files. (You have to edit the .java files)

Right click on the microsoft outlook configuration file and click Open With -> Notepad

Read full topic
